span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 n. 混和物：composed of or resulting from union of separate elements, ingredients, or parts
【例】mixed the chemicals together to form a new compound
【考法 2】 adj. 混合的：consisting of two or more substances, ingredients, elements, or parts
【例】the German language's propensity[prəu'pensiti] for compounding words
【考法 3】 v. 扩大，增多：to make greater in size, amount, or number
【例】We compounded our error by waiting too long to call for help.
【考法 4】 v. 和解：to agree for a consideration not to prosecute (an offense)
【例】compound a felony 私了案件
